The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height. It is centered on a white background. **Step 1: Creating a new coordinate system** Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 2: Creating the 2D sketch** Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch consists of one face (face_1) and one loop (loop_1) as follows: **face_1** **loop_1** - line_1: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.1007, 0.0] - line_2: Start Point = [0.1007, 0.0], End Point = [0.1007, 0.0252] - line_3: Start Point = [0.1007, 0.0252], End Point = [0.0252, 0.0252] - line_4: Start Point = [0.0252, 0.0252], End Point = [0.0252, 0.1007] - line_5: Start Point = [0.0252, 0.1007], End Point = [0.0, 0.1007] - line_6: Start Point = [0.0, 0.1007], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] **Step 3: Transforming the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch** Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the following parameters: - euler angles = [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - translation vector = [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Step 4: Extruding the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude depth towards normal = 0.75 - extrude depth opposite normal = 0.0 - sketch scale = 0.1007 - operation: Create a new solid body The dimensions of the resulting 3D model are (0.75 * 0.1007 =) 0.0755 units in height, (0.1007 * 2 =) 0.2014 units in width, and (0.1007 * 2 =) 0.2014 units in length.</description>
